editorialSummary.text: Modern hotel with a rooftop pool, a cocktail lounge & a restaurant, plus a spa, a gym & Wi-Fi.

text.text:
I would like to extend my sincere appreciation for Mr. Shaphek from the housekeeping team. His attention to detail, professionalism, and courteous attitude truly enhanced my stay at Country Inn & Suites by Radisson, Bengaluru Hebbal Road. Every request was handled promptly and with a warm smile, and the room was consistently maintained to the highest standards of cleanliness and comfort.

It’s clear that Shaphek takes great pride in his work, and it reflects in the impeccable service he provides. Employees like him are a great asset to the hotel. Thank you for making my experience so pleasant and memorable!

Im editing this post after staying here for 14days.
I am quite disappointed with my recent experiences at the Mosaic restaurant in Country Inn & Suites by Radisson, Bengaluru Hebbal Road. The “on-the-table” menu service is extremely slow — on one occasion, I had to wait at least 15–20 minutes just for a simple omelette, and on another day, the same delay happened for a boiled egg. Even after following up 3–4 times, there was no sense of urgency from the staff to serve the order. Eventually, on both occasions, I had to leave after waiting 20 minutes without being served.

The in-room dining service was no better. I requested two plates for lunch, and despite multiple follow-ups, the plates were brought only after 1.5 hours. This delay forced me to have my lunch at 4 p.m., which was extremely inconvenient and unacceptable for a hotel of this standard.

Overall, the lack of promptness, coordination, and basic service efficiency in both the restaurant and in-room dining was very disappointing. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and improves the speed and attentiveness of their service.

originalText.text:
Treebo Akshaya Bull Hotel – Clean, Comfortable & Worth It

Had a great stay here! The rooms were clean and well-maintained. Staff were polite, friendly, and always ready to help. The real highlight was the breakfast — simple, fresh, and truly satisfying. Perfect for a peaceful, budget-friendly stay in the city. Would definitely recommend!

text.text:
If there were an option to give negative stars, this place would deserve it. My stay here was nothing short of revolting. The so-called “clean” sheets had dried stains that looked suspiciously like blood. Towels were grimy and smelled unwashed, and the room seemed to be shared with cockroaches.

Basic hygiene and cleanliness—things one would expect even in the most budget accommodations—are utterly ignored here. It felt unsafe and unsanitary from the moment I walked in.

Treebo should be ashamed to put their name on this property. Staying here was not just unpleasant; it was unhygienic, unacceptable, and downright disgusting.

Do yourself a favor: avoid this place at all costs.

text.text:
The experience met my expectations, but there is significant room for improvement.
Liked · The location and access to the marriage hall are excellent. The staff are helpful, but they lack sufficient training. It is close to many famous temples, which is a major advantage.
Disliked · The bed was uncomfortable, and the rooms were not cleaned properly. The bedding and bed sheets had not been changed, leaving remnants from previous guests all over the bed. The staff did not consider my preferences and assigned me a room facing the roadside, which was quite noisy. Additionally, no credit card payments were accepted.

text.text:
recently had the pleasure of staying in this hotel and was genuinely impressed. it truly exceeded my expectations, largely thanks to its wonderful ambiance and outstanding staff.
From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the hotel's inviting atmosphere. The decor was tasteful and created a really cozy and welcoming feel, which isn't always common in this category. It felt like a peaceful retreat after a busy day.
What truly made my stay, however, was the team. Every staff member I encountered, from the front desk to housekeeping, was incredibly friendly, attentive, and genuinely eager to help. They went above and beyond to ensure my comfort, offering helpful local tips and always greeting me with a warm smile. Their professionalism and positive attitude were truly a highlight.

text.text:
I recently stayed at the icon boutique hotel, on a short business trip to which I barely used the services however when I did, I was rather disappointed as someone whose not from the country however is stil have alot of knowledge in hospitality as I’ myself are in the industry, rooms can be cleaner and paid more attention to in regards to cleanliness of bathrooms, linens and general cleaning. There was a sewer smell coming from the bathroom, the tiles and shower heads had grime and mould, towels didn’t look clean I in fact went to a store and purchased my own!

For the cost factor it’s rather midrange and not affordable to all considering the area is somewhat upmarket and close to streets that are always touristy busy. I also emailed and spoke with management in advance about me traveling and if it was possible to use an international card or foreign exchange and was told yes. When I arrive and tried to do so i was refused or told that wasn’t policy.

I then had an incident I ordered a drink and they had given me old soda water and charged me an insane amount for two drinks, I asked for record of purchase and did not receive I paid way more than I was supposed to but at that point did not want to argue.

Would I recommend it to tourists, or expats absolutely not. There’s lots of improvement needed, staff could be more helpful and friendly to those coming into the country.

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the room provided during our recent stay. The condition of the room was far below acceptable standards—it was extremely dirty and unhygienic.

We requested additional towels, but only one was provided. When we asked for another, we were told that no clean towels were available. This is completely unacceptable for any hotel, especially one that claims to accommodate families.

Furthermore, the bed was extremely small and could not comfortably fit three people, despite the booking being made with the understanding that the room was suitable for a family. Overall, the hotel did not meet even the basic expectations of a family-friendly environment.

text.text:
​Do not be deceived by any rating you see online. Calling this a 3-star hotel is a cruel joke; it operates on a scale of negative stars. My stay at Hotel Hindustan International Select was, without exaggeration, the worst hotel experience of my life.
​Service is a theoretical concept here. Expect to waste 15 minutes of your life just trying to get someone to answer the phone for room service. If you're lucky enough to have your request heard, prepare for an agonizing 30+ minute wait for it to materialize. The hotel itself is in a state of decay, with damp, crumbling walls in the washroom that speak of utter neglect. To top it all off, the housekeeping staff suffers from daily amnesia, consistently forgetting basic essentials like towels, forcing you back into the endless cycle of waiting for someone to do their job. This place is an abyss of incompetence. Save your money and your sanity—book literally anywhere else..

I had a good overall experience during my stay. The rooms were spacious, and the location was excellent, making it convenient for travel. The hospitality was warm, though the service was a bit slow at times.

Breakfast was adequate, but unfortunately, many items were not served hot, which could be improved.

There were some maintenance issues in the bathroom—the shower didn’t work properly, and I had to request a bucket and mug. Additionally, several parts in the bathroom were missing or broken, which was disappointing.

Another issue was the coffee kettle, which didn’t work in the morning. It took an hour to fix, which was inconvenient.

Despite these issues, the stay was pleasant overall, but some improvements in service and maintenance would make it much better.

text.text:
We stayed at Hotel Royal Orchid in a Deluxe King Size Room from June 21 to July 4 as a family with a child, and had a really enjoyable experience.

The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when it came to housekeeping — the room could’ve been a bit cleaner at first, but they responded quickly and took care of it when asked. The hotel amenities were great and added a lot to our stay, especially with a kid — everything felt safe, comfortable, and well-managed.

Dining was excellent — good variety, tasty food, and smooth service. The location is convenient, and the overall vibe of the hotel is relaxed yet elegant. Check-in and check-out were quick, and the room was spacious enough for a small family.

Overall, a solid stay with a few minor areas for improvement. Would definitely consider coming back!

From the moment I arrived, I was enchanted by this hotel. The grounds are simply stunning, a lush green paradise that feels like a tranquil escape from the world. Every corner is meticulously maintained, with vibrant gardens and towering trees creating a serene and beautiful atmosphere. It was a true pleasure to stroll through the pathways, and the constant presence of nature made the entire stay feel incredibly rejuvenating.

I must also extend a special thank you to Tia at the front desk. Her warm and welcoming demeanor made check-in a breeze. She was incredibly helpful throughout my stay, always ready with a smile and excellent recommendations. Her professionalism and genuine kindness are a true asset to the hotel, and she made a significant positive impact on my experience.

This hotel is a perfect choice for anyone seeking beauty, tranquility, and exceptional service. I can't wait to return to this green oasis Royal Orchid in middle of Bangalore City

text.text:
One of the Worst Hotel Experiences Ever

I rarely leave negative reviews, but I feel compelled to share my experience here. Unfortunately, this stay was nothing short of a disaster.

To start, the shower literally fell on my head while I was using it. It was a horrifying and painful experience that left me needing medical attention. I ended up in the hospital due to the injury, which completely ruined my trip. The staff, to their credit, were polite and apologetic, but that’s about the only positive thing I can say.

Despite the severity of the incident, the hotel did absolutely nothing to rectify the situation. There was no offer of a partial refund, compensation, or even a complimentary service to acknowledge the disaster. Considering the price I paid for this stay, I expected a lot more in terms of safety and customer care.

While the staff were friendly, their hands seemed tied, and the management's lack of action made this experience even worse. Honestly, it was not worth the money, and I would highly recommend avoiding this place if you're looking for a comfortable, safe, and worry-free stay. Definitely not up to par.

text.text:
We had a good overall stay, though a few things could’ve been better. The rooms, while compact, were clean, well-maintained, and offered a beautiful view of Haridwar - ideal for a business/solo stay. The shower area was surprisingly spacious, though I wasn’t a fan of the toilet and washbasin being combined. Still, it served the purpose well!!

A special shoutout to the Duty Manager from the Front Office who spoke to me before check-in; he was extremely kind and thoughtful. Since I had booked the stay as a surprise weekend getaway for my sister after a long work week, he arranged for a lovely handwritten note and a small pastry cake in the room. That personal touch truly made our arrival feel special!!!!

The gym and pool were great although we wish we had the time to use them!! At the restaurant, the service team was extremely hospitable - staff like Nandini and one more girl whose name I forgot were warm and friendly, and it made breakfast enjoyable. But, this was slightly marred when Subhash interrupted our chat and called them away abruptly, citing “work,” which felt unnecessary and unprofessional - brief interactions with guests should be welcomed, not shut down!!

The breakfast had an impressive spread of South Indian dishes, which were delicious. However, the bread section was a letdown - items like the toast, croissants, danish pastries, donuts, pancakes, waffles, and French toast lacked freshness and texture. I do hope they improve this area as they host more than just Indian guests. The chef was kind enough to check in and offer alternatives, which we appreciated!!!

One area that truly fell short was the handling of my late checkout request. The Front Office Manager Mr. Mallik said he would check and get back to us reg our request while he was checking us in the late evening, but never followed up. When I ran into him the next morning at the lobby, he didn’t acknowledge me at all or provide an answer - something as simple as a “yes” or “no” would have sufficed. That lack of basic courtesy was disappointing!!!

Despite these hiccups, the overall vibe of the hotel was good. With a few improvements in professionalism and breakfast variety, it could easily move from “good” to “great.” It’s a nice spot for solo travelers - whether for a short trip or an extended work stay!!!!

text.text:
We stayed here with our group of friends. The rooms were just okay in terms of cleanliness, and the overall setup was average. However, the major disappointment was the staff — they were not supportive at all. Even basic things like tea were not provided outside the strict breakfast timings. After 10:30 AM, they refused to serve even a single cup of tea, which was quite frustrating.

There are no nearby shops either for tea or other basic needs, which made it even more inconvenient. The staff seemed very rigid about check-out and breakfast timings, which didn’t leave a great impression. Honestly, I didn’t like this place much.

The only good thing is that it’s located near MG Road, so it's convenient for going out and enjoying places like Hangover. Other than the location, I wouldn't recommend this stay.

text.text:
The worst experience of all time!!! Beware when booking and stay clear. I was arriving December 15 at 2am. So I insisted and insisted and triple confirmed that I can check in on time, the room was booked for December 14 - naturally. After this was confirmed over and over, I arrived in the middle of the night and the place seemed abandoned. Then I managed to wake up the drivers security guard, who informed me that check in is at 11. I’m really not sure why I wasted hours on back and forth email, confirmations, and all that to be stranded in the middle of the night. Appalling! Also I managed to use the lobby bathroom and it was gross.

I ended up going to a nearby hotel that’s much nicer and much cheaper. Some sort of reward for the hell I went through.

Laika Boutique Stay offers a charming escape in the midst of Bangalore's bustling city life. This cozy shared space provides a comfortable and affordable option for a short stay.

The wooden furniture and neat decor create a warm and inviting atmosphere. While the facilities are basic, they're sufficient for a night or two. The location is a major plus, with easy access to Bangalore's vibrant food and nightlife scene.

Whether you're a solo traveler or a group of friends, Laika Boutique Stay is a great choice for exploring the city.

The breakfast was delicious with plenty of options. I truly appreciated the little touches that made the experience feel special. Highly recommend, and I can’t wait to come back!

text.text:
I stayed at UR Comforts during a recent visit to Bangalore and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is located in a calm area of Jayanagar, making it easy to access local shops, restaurants, and public transport.

The room was clean, spacious, and well-maintained. The bed was comfortable, and I appreciated the modern bathroom fittings and daily housekeeping. The Wi-Fi was stable and the AC worked well, which was a big plus during the hot afternoons.

What really stood out was the staff service – polite, helpful, and quick to respond to requests. I also enjoyed the South Indian breakfast, which felt authentic and homely.

text.text:
The name is terribly misleading. The Radiados name is a heavy
cross to bear.
The reception was painfully unaware of room
status when enquired for a different room than the top  assigned. A young lady with glasses had pathetic attitude. No polite greetings offered,  only a sour face.
The bathroom supplies in the room were wanting. one face towel for a double room is a glaring example.
The TV was another terrible  joke, only free channels are accessible and no paid one was given as an option. No pay per view option was available. The view outta our room was looking on to the first tier of an over pass meaning privacy was compromised if we didn’t draw the curtains…

On our second day a very unassuming lady from Orissa took it upon her to help us out and  went the extra mile and did manage to shift us from our room. Surprisingly the restaurant was pleasant. Servers were bending back wards to please. The chefs were smiling and helping out.
Food quality could be better but hey our meal was cracking.

All in all, won’t go back there in a hurry.

This is a cosy hotel right beside the  famous  Basavana Temple in Basavangudi,  Bengaluru.  It is strategically located, well maintained  and clean.The rooms are fairly spacious, wash room and linens are clean and the support staff are corteous and attentive.

In short  value for money.

text.text:
Stayed 3 days at Akshaya Treebo. Location wise it's on the dot. Excellent rooms with Ac, refrigerator, coffee Tea maker, 24 hours hot water, friendly staff, family oriented, very quiet indoors even though it's on busy street. There is no kitchen operations but they arrange very good breakfast, lunch and dinner etc to room. I experienced very good sleep quality. Most important it is quite affordable tariff for what you get, including the location. Place for only one car to park. Other wise, there is sufficient parking on opposite side on street.  Huge number of reputed brands of food joints at walking distance aa are many temples. All in all it's a very good option to stay a few days. Only negative I can think of is car parking within premises, but i suppose in Bangalore it's too much to ask.Did not face any issue to pickup autos or cabs nor it was in dense traffic area.
Will definitely visit again and recommend it

I recently had the pleasure of staying/dining at ITC Windsor Bengaluru, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. The staff were courteous and efficient, the rooms were immaculate and well-appointed, and the food was exquisite.

The attention to detail and warm hospitality made my stay truly special. I appreciated the seamless check-in/check-out process, the comfortable bed, and the excellent amenities.

Housekeeping Staff truly appreciate Specially
Mr. kumar very good service.

The restaurants served delicious cuisine with a wide variety of options. The breakfast spread was particularly impressive.

Overall, I highly recommend ITC Windsor, Bengaluru, for its:

1. Rich heritage ambiance
2. Unparalleled service
3. Luxurious amenities
4. Prime location

Looking forward to my next stay!

text.text:
#Interior
From the moment you step into it, the luxurious ambiance is palpable. The grand lobby, adorned with elegant chandeliers and contemporary art pieces, immediately sets a tone of sophistication and opulence. The interior design throughout the hotel is a tasteful blend of modern chic and classic elegance, with meticulous attention to detail evident in every corner. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed, featuring plush furnishings, high-quality linens, and state-of-the-art amenities that ensure a comfortable and stylish stay.

#Services
The service at is impeccable, truly deserving of a five-star rating. From the courteous and efficient front desk staff to the attentive housekeeping team, every member of the hotel staff goes above and beyond to cater to the guests' needs. The concierge service is particularly noteworthy, offering excellent recommendations and assistance with reservations, transportation, and local insights. Room service is prompt and professional, and the staff's warm hospitality makes you feel genuinely welcome.

# Food
The culinary offerings are nothing short of extraordinary. The on-site restaurants provide a diverse array of dining options, each one delivering a memorable gastronomic experience. The breakfast buffet is a feast for the senses, featuring an extensive selection of both local and international dishes, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. The fine dining restaurant is a highlight, offering a sophisticated menu that showcases the chef's creativity and expertise. Every meal is presented with artistic flair, and the flavors are impeccably balanced, making each bite a delight.

Highly recommended for those who seek the finest in hospitality.

text.text:
Wonderful place to stay for solo travellers and family. Situated behind Navarang theatre in Rajajinagar , the hotel provides all the basic amenities , including high speed wifi on all floors and there is elevator access on all floors and free breakfast which was so good ,cooked by kind ladies . The hotel staff were so nice and humble .
Location is 5 minutes walk from the metro station and all kinds of transportation are available. On the ground floor of the hotel , there is a seperate veg restaurant, self service one and super clean. You don’t have to travel a lot to eat food , also all the fast food restaurants are nearby. You can order food straight to room using food delivery apps .
There is security personnel 24 hours at the entrance of the hotel. If you need any help you can ask them.

The rooms are so immaculate and bathroom is big , spotless and well maintained .
Good air conditioning in all rooms
If you are visiting and looking for a place to stay in Rajajinagar, go ahead with Savees Residency.

text.text:
Decent stay but room hygiene and food could be better

Rating: 3/5

I recently stayed at Hotel Icon in Indiranagar for 2 nights. The rooms were fairly clean and spacious with good amenities as expected from a 4-star hotel. The location is excellent with easy access to metro station, markets and eateries.

However I faced a couple issues during my stay:
1) I found old menus and used plates that were not cleaned properly from my room. Better room hygiene should be maintained.
2) The food quality across restaurants is average but priced on the higher side. The breakfast buffet spread had limited options and some dishes tasted bland.

To summarize, the hotel's location, decor and service staff are good. But I was disappointed with the lax housekeeping around room service items not being picked up and average overpriced meals. Given these downsides, the tariff felt too high.

I would rate Icon 3 out of 5 stars. It makes for an acceptable business stay but they need to improve on basics like room hygiene and ensure food quality matches price points charged across dining places.

text.text: I had checked in AC room with triple occupancy - being with family. The rooms were clean, spacious and lot of natural light. The windows were also fitted with mosquito net if at all anyone wanted to get fresh air in the room. The hotel service was very quick. During our 4 day stay we didn't face any issues at all. They also have Udupi Veg restaurant at the ground floor which made our stay more comfortable (the food and service was good). Prime location with ample of car parking. Price wise its bit costly but considering the cleaniness and spacious rooms it is worth spending extra. I would select this hotel if I plan to visit Banglore next time! **Suggestion for non AC rooms: they have a wall mounted single fan in non AC room with triple occupancy - one near double bed and one near sofa. Please put a proper ceiling fan in rooms as wall mounted fan is not enough! **Toilet paper rolls should be kept in washroom.

text.text:
My family of four arriving after a long trip from US, recently stayed at Treebo Trend Sahara Suites in Madiwala, Bangalore. Our experience at this hotel was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by the friendly and accommodating staff who made us feel welcome and valued throughout our stay.

Jabir, in particular, deserves special recognition for going above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. He was truly the person who made our stay a memorable one, taking care of every detail and making sure everything went incredibly smoothly. Despite our party having eight large bags, Jabir was more than willing to assist us with them, making the check-in process hassle-free. All of their staff are incredibly helpful, Raheem cordinated with transportation of luggage bags and Chinna helped with registration.

The hotel itself is a gem. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well-maintained, offering a comfortable retreat after a long day of exploring the city. We stayed on the fourth floor. The amenities provided were excellent, including a cozy bed, a flat-screen TV, and a mini fridge. The Wi-Fi connection was reliable and fast, which was important for both leisure and work purposes.

Overall, I cannot recommend Treebo Trend Sahara Suites enough for its exceptional service and comfortable accommodations. The hotel staff, particularly Jabir, truly went above and beyond to ensure our stay was memorable and stress-free. I would definitely choose this hotel again for my future visits to Bangalore.

We stayed at Hotel Royal Orchid in a Deluxe King Size Room from June 21 to July 4 as a family with a child, and had a really enjoyable experience.

The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when it came to housekeeping — the room could’ve been a bit cleaner at first, but they responded quickly and took care of it when asked. The hotel amenities were great and added a lot to our stay, especially with a kid — everything felt safe, comfortable, and well-managed.

Dining was excellent — good variety, tasty food, and smooth service. The location is convenient, and the overall vibe of the hotel is relaxed yet elegant. Check-in and check-out were quick, and the room was spacious enough for a small family.

Overall, a solid stay with a few minor areas for improvement. Would definitely consider coming back!

text.text:
Overall Great place, I would have given it 5 stars but for their food & restaurant staff. The location and overall service from the hotel staff was great would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a nice stay in the city with plenty of places within a 10-15 min walking distance. Also very close to Kormangla. I would recommend staying here but eating somewhere else!

Pros
Rooms were very clean , everything worked well no issues with anything in the room, beds were comfy and room had a nice ambiance. The house keeping staff were also nice and helpful.

Cons
-The food & the servers. We were a party of 3 and if 1 person asked for water they would only bring 1 glass to the table. We literally had to ask for every single little thing & felt like the dining service was less than satisfactory. Secondly the breakfast options & food quality were also less than satisfactory the Idly was cold and hard, the dosa we ordered didn't taste fresh at all,
We felt they could have done a better job with the breakfast scene. We even had lunch there and had roti with mixed vegetable sabzi and it was below average it didn't have much taste or flavor and the price you pay for it doesn't equate to the quality of food in return.

text.text:
The Elanza Hotel is a boutique hotel located in the heart of the city, just 0.5 km from M G Road. It is an ideal choice for discerning business travelers who are looking for an elegant and fully furnished accommodation. The hotel has about 40 plus rooms, including a banquet hall and a boardroom. The rooms are tastefully decorated with modern amenities and are designed to provide maximum comfort to guests. However, the bathrooms are quite small and in need of some work. The reception staff needs some customer service training long wait time for check-in and they seem very rude all the time, like overworked. This can be a bit of a hassle for business travelers who are pressed for time. The hotel management should look into this issue and take steps to improve the check-in process and the way they are towards the guest. At least a smile. The breakfast offered at the hotel is limited but good. The well-connected internet is a plus for business travelers who need to stay connected with their work. However, the rooms are small in size and the hotel needs a revamp to provide a more modern and comfortable experience for guests.

Overall, the Elanza Hotel is a decent choice for business travelers who are looking for a centrally located boutique hotel with basic amenities. However, the hotel management needs to address the issues of customer service, room size, and bathroom conditions to make the stay more comfortable and enjoyable for guests.

text.text:
The ONLY good hotel if you are looking for accommodation near NIMHANS. Wasted more than an hour around the area until we finally found ZION.

Lobby , elevator, rooms, washrooms, beds are all new and comfy.

Staff are polite and courteous.

Cons :

Parking :
Building had space for 2-3 cars to be parked in basement, although not recommended as the entrance to basement is too steep and hence low ground clearance vehicles should avoid.

There is space for 2 cars on front of the building , however, during daytime mostly occupied by local bikes and auto (tuk tuks)

Pretty Noisy inside the rooms, as I had chosen the roadside room.

Overall a nice accommodation miles above when compared to nearby hotels

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson Blu Centre City, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in every way. As a seasoned traveler, I've had my fair share of hotel experiences, but this one truly stood out.

From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warm smiles and impeccable service. The staff were attentive, efficient, and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was nothing short of exceptional.

The room was tastefully decorated, with a perfect blend of modern amenities and comfortable furnishings. The bed was plush, the bathroom was spotless, and the views of the city were simply stunning.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel's commitment to sustainability. From the eco-friendly toiletries to the energy-efficient lighting, it was clear that the Radisson Blu Centre City is dedicated to reducing its environmental footprint.

The hotel's location is also worth mentioning. Situated in the heart of the city, it's within walking distance to many popular attractions, restaurants, and shops.

In conclusion, my stay at the Radisson Blu Centre City was truly unforgettable. With its exceptional hospitality, comfortable accommodations, and commitment to sustainability, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a top-notch experience in the city.

From its elegant rooms to its exquisite cuisine, this hotel is sure to provide you with an unforgettable experience. The staff is friendly and professional, and they go out of their way to ensure that your stay is as comfortable as possible. The amenities are top-notch. And the views are stunning! Whether you're looking for a romantic getaway or a family vacation, this hotel has something for everyone. With its great service and excellent facilities, it's no wonder why this Nice stay hotel gets such rave reviews from guests!

text.text:
Laika Boutique Stay offers a charming escape in the midst of Bangalore's bustling city life. This cozy shared space provides a comfortable and affordable option for a short stay.

The wooden furniture and neat decor create a warm and inviting atmosphere. While the facilities are basic, they're sufficient for a night or two. The location is a major plus, with easy access to Bangalore's vibrant food and nightlife scene.

Whether you're a solo traveler or a group of friends, Laika Boutique Stay is a great choice for exploring the city.

text.text:
This place has got hospitality done right. I love everything about it: the cozy feeling, the lovely accommodating staff, the endless amenities, and everything else in between for a very reasonable price. Leave it to the city of Bangalore to pull off a feat like this.
I was concerned about my car (parking) but with a reassuring valet, I hesitatingly left the keys with him only to look outside my window just after 10 to find my car parked safely right under my window.  Well done, urcomforts. Keep up the good work.

text.text:
Worth it! Be it the big enough rooms with a lot of furnishings, the location of this hotel, the prompt response and service from the staffs and the receptionist, all together had really a created a good impression overall to me!
I had a 4 day stay here and it was such a convenient and hot spot location for one to explore and to have access to the urban areas!
Just that they don’t have a parking, adjustable for 2 wheelers in the street but for a car you will have to make arrangements yourself! Just that one concerned me!
Overall good and nice experience! :)
